posts.title: Derived Functors
posts.excerpt: Homological algebra里的经典导出函子理论, 主要抄书参考 gtm4, 这一节暂时没有涉及到导出函子的计算理论, 以后有空补上. (；′⌒`)
posts.text: Homological algebra里的经典导出函子理论, 主要抄书参考 gtm4, 这一节暂时没有涉及到导出函子的计算理论, 以后有空补上. (；′⌒`) Left Derived Functor Definition 1. For an object AAA in abelian category A\mathcal{A}A and its projective resolution PPP, let T:Ch(A)→Ch(A)T:\mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})\to \mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})T:Ch(A)→Ch(A) be an addictive functor. We define the left derived functor of TTT, LnT(A)=Hn(TP)L_{n}T(A)=H_{n}(TP)Ln​T(A)=Hn​(TP) $$TP: \quad \cdots \to TP_{n}\to TP_{n-1}\to\cdots\to TP_{0}\to 0$$ From the Revolution we know for fˉ:A→B\bar{f}:A\to Bfˉ​:A→B, the morphism fˉ\bar{f}fˉ​ induces f:P→Qf:P\to Qf:P→Q, where PPP, QQQ are projective resolution of AAA, BBB respectively. So when applying H(−)H(-)H(−), the left derived functor is indeed a functor. Now we verify LnT(A)L_{n}T(A)Ln​T(A) is well-defined, i.e. for P,QP, QP,Q two projective resolution of AAA, there’s an isomorphism LnPT(A)≅LnQT(A)L_{n}^{P}T(A)\cong L_{n}^{Q}T(A)LnP​T(A)≅LnQ​T(A). Since the two projective resolutions are of the same homotopy type, i.e. ∃f:P→Q\exists f:P\to Q∃f:P→Q and g:Q→Pg:Q\to Pg:Q→P with fg≃idQfg\simeq id_{Q}fg≃idQ​, gf≃idPgf\simeq id_{P}gf≃idP​. Then TfTfTf, TgTgTg gives homotopy equivalence between TPTPTP and TQTQTQ since TTT is addictive. Since homotopic morphisms will give the same homology morphisms, we have Hn(TP)≅Hn(TQ)H_{n}(TP)\cong H_{n}(TQ)Hn​(TP)≅Hn​(TQ), i.e. LnPT(A)≅LnQT(A)L_{n}^{P}T(A)\cong L_{n}^{Q}T(A)LnP​T(A)≅LnQ​T(A). Definition 2. An covariant functor FFF is left eact if for every exact sequence 0→A1→A2→A30\to A_{1}\to A_{2}\to A_{3}0→A1​→A2​→A3​, the sequence 0→FA1→FA2→FA30\to FA_{1}\to FA_{2}\to FA_{3}0→FA1​→FA2​→FA3​ is exact. Definition 3. An covariant functor FFF is right eact if for every exact sequence A1→A2→A3→0A_{1}\to A_{2}\to A_{3}\to 0A1​→A2​→A3​→0, the sequence FA1→FA2→FA3→0FA_{1}\to FA_{2}\to FA_{3}\to 0FA1​→FA2​→FA3​→0 is exact. Definition 4. An covariant functor FFF is eact if it is left and right exact. Theorem 1. Let T:Ch(A)→Ch(A)T:\mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})\to \mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})T:Ch(A)→Ch(A) be a right exact functor, then L0TL_{0}TL0​T and TTT are naturally isomorphic. Proof Proof. For a projective resolution PPP of AAA, applying TTT to PPP, we have TP1→TP2→TP3→0TP_{1}\to TP_{2}\to TP_{3}\to 0TP1​→TP2​→TP3​→0 exact. So H0(TP)≅TAH_{0}(TP)\cong TAH0​(TP)≅TA. The naturality is obvious. ◻ Proposition 1. The functor LnT:A→AL_{n}T:\mathcal{A}\to\mathcal{A}Ln​T:A→A is an addictive functor. Proof Proof. Omitted. ◻ Theorem 2. Let 0→fKq→Pq−1→⋯→P0→A→00\xrightarrow{f}K_{q}\to P_{q-1}\to \cdots\to P_{0}\to A\to 00f​Kq​→Pq−1​→⋯→P0​→A→0 be an exact sequence with Pq−1,…,P0P_{q-1},\dots, P_{0}Pq−1​,…,P0​ projective. If TTT is right exact, then the sequence $$0\to L_{q}TA\to TK_{q}\xrightarrow{Tf}TP_{q-1}$$ is exact. Proof Proof. Consider ⋯→Pq+1→Pq→Kq→0\cdots\to P_{q+1}\to P_{q}\to K_{q}\to 0⋯→Pq+1​→Pq​→Kq​→0 a projective resolution of KqK_{q}Kq​. Then we get an projective resolution of AAA by⋯→Pq+1→Pq→Pq−1→⋯→P0→A→0\cdots\to P_{q+1}\to P_{q}\to P_{q-1}\to \cdots\to P_{0}\to A\to 0⋯→Pq+1​→Pq​→Pq−1​→⋯→P0​→A→0Since TTT is right exact, we consider the diagramBy snake lemma, we get an exact sequenceTPq+1→Tdq+1KerTdq→KerTf→δ0TP_{q+1}\xrightarrow{Td_{q+1}}\mathrm{Ker}Td_{q}\to \mathrm{Ker}Tf\xrightarrow{\delta}0TPq+1​Tdq+1​​KerTdq​→KerTfδ​0By exactness, KerTf≅KerTdq/ImTdq+1=Hq(TP)\mathrm{Ker}Tf\cong \mathrm{Ker}Td_{q} /\mathrm{Im}Td_{q+1}=H_{q}(TP)KerTf≅KerTdq​/ImTdq+1​=Hq​(TP). ◻ Using duality, we have a similar theorem: Theorem 3. Let Pq→dqPq−1→⋯→P0→A→0P_{q}\xrightarrow{d_{q}}P_{q-1}\to \cdots\to P_{0}\to A\to 0Pq​dq​​Pq−1​→⋯→P0​→A→0 be an exact sequence, where Pq−1,…,P0P_{q-1}, \dots, P_{0}Pq−1​,…,P0​ are projective. If TTT is left exact, then the sequence $$T(P_{q})\to T(\mathrm{Im}d_{q})\to L_{q-1}T(A)\to 0$$ is exact. Right Derived Functor Definition 5. For an object AAA in abelian category A\mathcal{A}A and its injective resolution III, let T:Coch(A)→Coch(A)T:\mathrm{Coch}(\mathcal{A})\to \mathrm{Coch}(\mathcal{A})T:Coch(A)→Coch(A) be an addictive functor. We define the right derived functor of TTT, RnT(A)=Hn(TI)R^{n}T(A)=H^{n}(TI)RnT(A)=Hn(TI) $$TI: \quad 0\to TI_{0}\to\cdots\to TI_{q}\to TI_{q+1}\to \cdots$$ Similarly, we can prove RnTR^{n}TRnT is a well-defined functor. Theorem 4. If TTT is left exact, then R0TR^{0}TR0T is naturally isomorphic to TTT. Proof Proof. Omitted. ◻ If we choose TTT to be a controvariant functor, we use the projective resolution PPP of AAA to make TPTPTP a cochain. Then we will have similar proposition as left derived functor. Derived Long Exact Sequence From the long exact sequence theorem, we can derive the following theorems. Lemma 1 (Horseshoe). For exact sequence 0→A′→fA→gA′′→00\to A'\xrightarrow{f}A\xrightarrow{g}A''\to 00→A′f​Ag​A′′→0 and projective resolution P′P'P′, P′′P''P′′ of A′A'A′ and A′′A''A′′ respectively. There exists projective resolution PPP of AAA s.t. the following diagram commutes and rows exact. Proof Proof. Let P=P′⊕P′′P=P'\oplus P''P=P′⊕P′′, we have PPP also a projective and acyclic chain complex. Then 0→P′→P→P′′→00\to P'\to P\to P''\to 00→P′→P→P′′→0 is an exact sequence.We use induction to build P→A→0P\to A\to 0P→A→0.First for n=0n=0n=0:By projectivity, we can find h0:P0′′→Ah_{0}:P''_{0}\to Ah0​:P0′′​→A with gh0=d0gh_{0}=d_{0}gh0​=d0​. Since P0P_{0}P0​ is a direct sum andP0′→fd0A←h0P0′′P'_{0}\xrightarrow{fd_{0}}A\xleftarrow{h_{0}}P''_{0}P0′​fd0​​Ah0​​P0′′​we have a unique morphism d0:P0→Ad_{0}:P_{0}\to Ad0​:P0​→A. Using the snake lemma we can conclude P0→A→0P_{0}\to A\to 0P0​→A→0 exact.Suppose for n≥1n\geq 1n≥1, the induction step is exactly the same as n=0n=0n=0. ◻ Now we give the long exact sequence theorem of left derived functor. Theorem 5. Let T:Ch(A)→Ch(A)T:\mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})\to \mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})T:Ch(A)→Ch(A) be a covariant addictive functor. 0→A′→A→A′′→00\to A' \to A\to A''\to 00→A′→A→A′′→0 is a short exact sequence. Then there are ωn:LnTA′′→Ln−1TA′\omega_{n}:L_{n}TA''\to L_{n-1}TA'ωn​:Ln​TA′′→Ln−1​TA′ s.t. the following sequence exact ⋯→LnTA′→LnTA→LnTA′′→Ln−1TA′→⋯→L0TA′′→0\cdots\to L_{n}TA'\to L_{n}TA\to L_{n}TA''\to L_{n-1}TA'\to \cdots\to L_{0}TA''\to 0 ⋯→Ln​TA′→Ln​TA→Ln​TA′′→Ln−1​TA′→⋯→L0​TA′′→0 Proof Proof. Applying lemma above to we get a commtative dagram with exact rows:Since P=P′⊕P′′P=P'\oplus P''P=P′⊕P′′, TTT is addictive, we have 0→TP′→TP→TP′′→00\to TP'\to TP\to TP''\to 00→TP′→TP→TP′′→0 exact. Using long exact sequence theorem we have the long exact sequence⋯→LnTA′→LnTA→LnTA′′→Ln−1TA′→⋯→L0TA′′→0\cdots\to L_{n}TA'\to L_{n}TA\to L_{n}TA''\to L_{n-1}TA'\to \cdots\to L_{0}TA''\to 0⋯→Ln​TA′→Ln​TA→Ln​TA′′→Ln−1​TA′→⋯→L0​TA′′→0◻ Let θ:T→T′\theta:T\to T'θ:T→T′ be a natural transformation, we can define morphism θP:TP→T′P\theta_{P}:TP\to T'PθP​:TP→T′P. Then θP\theta_{P}θP​ induces a natural transformation θAn:LnTA→LnT′A\theta_{A}^{n}:L_{n}TA\to L_{n}T'AθAn​:Ln​TA→Ln​T′A. Theorem 6. Let θ:T→T′\theta:T\to T'θ:T→T′ be a natural transformation. The diagram is commtative with exact rows Then the following diagram commutes with exact rows: 1. 2. Proof Proof. Omitted. Using generalized snake lemma. ◻ Definition 6. We say a sequence of functor 0→T′→T→T′′→00\to T'\to T\to T''\to 00→T′→T→T′′→0 exact on projectives if for every projective objects PPP, the sequence 0→T′P→TP→T′′P→00\to T'P\to TP\to T''P\to 00→T′P→TP→T′′P→0 is exact. Theorem 7. Let the sequence 0→T′→T→T′′→00\to T'\to T\to T''\to 00→T′→T→T′′→0 be exact on projectives. Then for every object AAA, there are morphisms ωn:LnT′′A→LnT′A\omega_{n}:L_{n}T''A\to L_{n}T'Aωn​:Ln​T′′A→Ln​T′A s.t. there’s long exact sequence ⋯→LnT′A→LnTA→LnT′′A→Ln−1T′A→⋯→L0T′′A→0\cdots\to L_{n}T'A\to L_{n}TA\to L_{n}T''A\to L_{n-1}T'A\to \cdots\to L_{0}T''A\to 0 ⋯→Ln​T′A→Ln​TA→Ln​T′′A→Ln−1​T′A→⋯→L0​T′′A→0 Proof Proof. Omitted. ◻ Theorem 8. Let f:A→A′f:A\to A'f:A→A′ be a morphism and be a commtative diagram with exact rows on projectives. Then the following diagrams commtutes with exact rows: 1. 2. Proof Proof. Omitted. Using generalized snake lemma. ◻

posts.title: Resolution
posts.excerpt: Resolution, 构造projective, injective, free和flat解消能够用来计算一系列导出函子. Resolution也是定义导出函子的前置. 这一节主要考虑projective resolution.
posts.text: Resolution, 构造projective, injective, free和flat解消能够用来计算一系列导出函子. Resolution也是定义导出函子的前置. 这一节主要考虑projective resolution. Resolution We will consider chain complexes AAA in Ch≥0(A)\mathrm{Ch}_{\geq 0}(\mathcal{A})Ch≥0​(A). A⋯→An→An−1→⋯→A0→0A\qquad \cdots\xrightarrow{}A_{n}\xrightarrow{}A_{n-1}\xrightarrow{}\cdots \xrightarrow{}A_{0}\xrightarrow{}0 A⋯​An​​An−1​​⋯​A0​​0 We first give definition to projective and acyclic complexes. Definition 1. A chain complex AAA is projective if AnA_{n}An​ is projective for n≥0n\geq 0n≥0. Definition 2. A chain complex AAA is acyclic if Hn(A)=0H_{n}(A)=0Hn​(A)=0 for all n≥1n\geq 1n≥1. The chain complex AAA is acyclic if and only if the sequence ⋯→A1→A0→H0(A)→0\cdots\xrightarrow{}A_{1}\xrightarrow{}A_{0}\xrightarrow{}H_{0}(A)\to 0 ⋯​A1​​A0​​H0​(A)→0 is exact. Definition 3. An acyclic and projective complex is called a projective resolution of H0(A)H_{0}(A)H0​(A). The projective resolution of AAA may not be the same, but they must be in the same homotopy type. We will prove this theorem. Theorem 1. Let A:⋯→A1→A0→0A:\cdots\to A_{1}\to A_{0}\to 0A:⋯→A1​→A0​→0 and B:⋯→B1→B0→0B:\cdots \to B_{1}\to B_{0}\to 0B:⋯→B1​→B0​→0 be two chain complex. AAA is projective and BBB is acyclic. Then for every fˉ:H0(A)→H0(B)\bar{f}:H_{0}(A)\to H_{0}(B)fˉ​:H0​(A)→H0​(B) there exists a morphism f:A→Bf:A\to Bf:A→B inducing fˉ\bar{f}fˉ​. Proof Proof. We construct the map f:A→Bf:A\to Bf:A→B inductively.First for n=0n=0n=0:Since the lower row is exact, by projectivity, ∃f0:A0→B0\exists f_{0}:A_{0}\to B_{0}∃f0​:A0​→B0​ with the diagram commutes.Suppose for n≥1n\geq 1n≥1, f0,f1,dots,fn−1f_{0},f_{1},dots,f_{n-1}f0​,f1​,dots,fn−1​ are constructed. Consider the diagramFrom the projectivity, we can find fn:An→Bnf_{n}:A_{n}\to B_{n}fn​:An​→Bn​ with fn−1dn=dnfnf_{n-1}d_{n}=d_{n}f_{n}fn−1​dn​=dn​fn​ by considering the diagram:Then we show the homotopy. Assume f,gf,gf,g be two morphisms satisfying the condition. We define h:f→gh:f\to gh:f→g inductively.First for n=0n=0n=0:Since f0f_{0}f0​, g0g_{0}g0​ both make the diagram commute, f0−g0f_{0}-g_{0}f0​−g0​ maps A0A_{0}A0​ intoKer(B0→H0(B))=Im(B1→B0)\mathrm{Ker}(B_{0}\to H_{0}(B))=\mathrm{Im}(B_{1}\to B_{0})Ker(B0​→H0​(B))=Im(B1​→B0​). From projectivity, ∃h0:A0→B1\exists h_{0}:A_{0}\to B_{1}∃h0​:A0​→B1​ with f0−g0=d1h0f_{0}-g_{0}=d_{1}h_{0}f0​−g0​=d1​h0​ by considering the diagramSuppose for n≥1n\geq 1n≥1 we have h0,…,hn−1h_{0},\dots, h_{n-1}h0​,…,hn−1​. Consider the diagramdn(fn−gn−hn−1dn)=fn−1dn−gn−1dn−dnhn−1dn=(fn−1−gn−1−dnhn−1)dn=hn−2dn−1dn=0\begin{aligned} d_{n}(f_{n}-g_{n}-h_{n-1}d_{n})&=f_{n-1}d_{n}-g_{n-1}d_{n}-d_{n}h_{n-1}d_{n}\\&=(f_{n-1}-g_{n-1}-d_{n}h_{n-1})d_{n}\\&=h_{n-2}d_{n-1}d_{n}=0\end{aligned}dn​(fn​−gn​−hn−1​dn​)​=fn−1​dn​−gn−1​dn​−dn​hn−1​dn​=(fn−1​−gn−1​−dn​hn−1​)dn​=hn−2​dn−1​dn​=0​From projectivity, we have hn:An→Bn+1h_{n}:A_{n}\to B_{n+1}hn​:An​→Bn+1​ s.t. fn−gn−hn−1dn=dn+1hnf_{n}-g_{n}-h_{n-1}d_{n}=d_{n+1}h_{n}fn​−gn​−hn−1​dn​=dn+1​hn​ by considering the diagram◻ Definition 4. We say abelian category A\mathcal{A}A has enough projective if for every object AAA, there is at least one projective object PPP s.t. P→fA→0P\xrightarrow{f}A\to 0Pf​A→0 exact. Then 0→Kerf→P→fA→00\to \mathrm{Ker}f\to P\xrightarrow{f}A\to 00→Kerf→Pf​A→0 is a short exact sequence. It’s not difficult to verify category Mod\mathrm{Mod}Mod has enough projectives. We can construct a projective resolution for AAA if category A\mathcal{A}A has enough projectives. We can construct as the following diagram: Theorem 2. Any two projective resolution of AAA are the same homotopy type. Proof Proof. Obvious corollary of the preceeding theorem. ◻ For the injective resolution, it’s just the duality case of projectives resolution. We do not talk about it solely.

posts.title: Homotopy
posts.excerpt: Homological algebra初步, 对一些homotopy性质的讨论. Homology函子将homotopic的morphism映射到相同的morphism, 这是以后讨论homotopy需要用到的最根本的性质之一. 以及这个homotopy定义实在是抽象.
posts.text: Homological algebra初步, 对一些homotopy性质的讨论. Homology函子将homotopic的morphism映射到相同的morphism, 这是以后讨论homotopy需要用到的最根本的性质之一. 以及这个homotopy定义实在是抽象. Homotopy Definition 1. A homotopy h:f→gh:f\to gh:f→g between two maps f,g:A→Bf,g: A\to Bf,g:A→B is a family of morphisms hn:An→Bnh_{n}:A_{n}\to B_{n}hn​:An​→Bn​ s.t. the following diagram commutes and fn−gn=dn+1hn+hn−1dnf_{n}-g_{n}=d_{n+1}h_{n}+h_{n-1}d_{n}fn​−gn​=dn+1​hn​+hn−1​dn​ for all nnn. We write f≃gf\simeq gf≃g. We give some basic property of homotopy. Proposition 1. The homotopy relation is an equivalence. Proof Proof.For tansitivity: If f≃gf\simeq gf≃g, g≃hg\simeq hg≃h,fn−gn=dn+1sn+sn−1dnf_{n}-g_{n}=d_{n+1}s_{n}+s_{n-1}d_{n}fn​−gn​=dn+1​sn​+sn−1​dn​gn−hn=dn+1tn+tn−1dng_{n}-h_{n}=d_{n+1}t_{n}+t_{n-1}d_{n}gn​−hn​=dn+1​tn​+tn−1​dn​Sofn−gn=dn+1(sn+tn)+(sn−1+tn−1)dnf_{n}-g_{n}=d_{n+1}(s_{n}+t_{n})+(s_{n-1}+t_{n-1})d_{n}fn​−gn​=dn+1​(sn​+tn​)+(sn−1​+tn−1​)dn​ i.e. f≃hf\simeq hf≃h.For symmetric: If f≃gf\simeq gf≃g, $$f_{n}-g_{n}=d_{n+1}h_{n}+h_{n-1}d_{n}\Rightarrow g_{n}-f_{n}=d_{n+1}(-h_{n})+(-h_{n-1})d_{n}$$For reflectivity: Obvious. ◻ Proposition 2. Let f≃g:A→Bf\simeq g:A\to Bf≃g:A→B, f′≃g′:B→Cf'\simeq g':B\to Cf′≃g′:B→C, then f′f≃g′g:A→Cf'f\simeq g'g:A\to Cf′f≃g′g:A→C. Proof Proof. Let fn−gn=dn+1hn+hn−1dnf_{n}-g_{n}=d_{n+1}h_{n}+h_{n-1}d_{n}fn​−gn​=dn+1​hn​+hn−1​dn​ and fn′−gn′=dn+1hn′+hn−1′dnf'_{n}-g'_{n}=d_{n+1}h'_{n}+h'_{n-1}d_{n}fn′​−gn′​=dn+1​hn′​+hn−1′​dn​. Thengn′fn−gn′gn=gn′dn+1hn+gn′hn−1dn=dn+1(gn′hn)+(gn′hn−1)dng'_{n}f_{n}-g'_{n}g_{n}=g'_{n}d_{n+1}h_{n}+g'_{n}h_{n-1}d_{n}=d_{n+1}(g'_{n}h_{n})+(g'_{n}h_{n-1})d_{n}gn′​fn​−gn′​gn​=gn′​dn+1​hn​+gn′​hn−1​dn​=dn+1​(gn′​hn​)+(gn′​hn−1​)dn​fn′fn−gn′fn=dn+1hnfn−hn−1dnfn=dn+1(hnfn)+(hn−1fndn)f'_{n}f_{n}-g'_{n}f_{n}=d_{n+1}h_{n}f_{n}-h_{n-1}d_{n}f_{n}=d_{n+1}(h_{n}f_{n})+(h_{n-1}f_{n}d_{n})fn′​fn​−gn′​fn​=dn+1​hn​fn​−hn−1​dn​fn​=dn+1​(hn​fn​)+(hn−1​fn​dn​)Thus gn′fn≃gn′gng'_{n}f_{n}\simeq g'_{n}g_{n}gn′​fn​≃gn′​gn​ and fn′fn≃gn′fnf'_{n}f_{n}\simeq g'_{n}f_{n}fn′​fn​≃gn′​fn​, so fn′fn≃gn′gnf'_{n}f_{n}\simeq g'_{n}g_{n}fn′​fn​≃gn′​gn​. ◻ Proposition 3. Let F:Ch(A)→Ch(A)F:\mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})\to \mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})F:Ch(A)→Ch(A) be an addictive functor. If f≃g:A→Bf\simeq g:A\to Bf≃g:A→B, then Ff≃Fg:FA→FBFf\simeq Fg:FA\to FBFf≃Fg:FA→FB. Proof Proof. Let h:f→gh:f\to gh:f→g. Then we have$$\begin{aligned}Ff_{n}-Fg_{n}&=F(d_{n+1}h_{n}+h_{n-1}d_{n})\\&= F(d_{n+1})F(h_{n})+F(h_{n-1})F(d_{n})\end{aligned}$$So Ff≃FgFf\simeq FgFf≃Fg. ◻ Homotopy and homology functor The homotopic morphisms will induce the same morphism under homology functor H(−)H(-)H(−). Theorem 1. For f≃g:A→Bf\simeq g:A\to Bf≃g:A→B with h:f→gh:f\to gh:f→g, we have H(f)≃H(g)H(f)\simeq H(g)H(f)≃H(g). Proof Proof.$$\begin{aligned}\mathrm{Im}(f-g)&=(f-g)(\mathrm{Ker}d_{n})\\&=d_{n+1}h_{n}(\mathrm{Ker}d_{n})+h_{n-1}d_{n}(\mathrm{Ker}d_{n})\\&=d_{n+1}h_{n}(\mathrm{Ker}d_{n})\subset\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}\end{aligned}$$So H(f−g)=0H(f-g)=0H(f−g)=0, i.e. H(f)=H(g)H(f)=H(g)H(f)=H(g). ◻ There’s an example f≄gf\not\simeq gf≃g but H(f)=H(g)H(f)=H(g)H(f)=H(g). Take the chain complex Let f0=id:Z→Zf_{0}=id:\mathbb{Z}\to \mathbb{Z}f0​=id:Z→Z and gn≡0g_{n}\equiv 0gn​≡0, we have Hn(f)=Hn(g)=0H_{n}(f)=H_{n}(g)=0Hn​(f)=Hn​(g)=0 since H0(A)=Z2H_{0}(A)=Z_{2}H0​(A)=Z2​ and H0(B)=ZH_{0}(B)=\mathbb{Z}H0​(B)=Z. However, f≄gf\not\simeq gf≃g, to see this, we tensor Z2Z_{2}Z2​ on AAA and BBB as Z\mathbb{Z}Z module. H0(A⊗Z2)≅Z2H_{0}(A\otimes Z_{2})\cong Z_{2}H0​(A⊗Z2​)≅Z2​ and H0(B⊗Z2)≅Z2H_{0}(B\otimes Z_{2})\cong Z_{2}H0​(B⊗Z2​)≅Z2​, H0(f⊗id)=1H_{0}(f\otimes id)=1H0​(f⊗id)=1 but H(g⊗Z2)=0H(g\otimes Z_{2})=0H(g⊗Z2​)=0. From Proposition 3 above, fff and ggg cannot be homotopic.

posts.title: Chain Complex
posts.excerpt: Homological algebra初步的初步. Chain complex的定义以及一些性质. 再没有tikz-cd我要死了.
posts.text: Homological algebra初步的初步. Chain complex的定义以及一些性质. 再没有tikz-cd我要死了. Chain Complex Definition 1. A chain complex (A,d)(A,d)(A,d) in an addicitive category A\mathcal{A}A is a family of objects and morphisms: $$\cdots\xrightarrow{}A_{n+1}\xrightarrow{d_{n+1}}A_{n}\xrightarrow{d_{n}}A_{n-1}\xrightarrow{}\cdots$$ with di−1∘di=0d_{i-1}\circ d_{i}=0di−1​∘di​=0 for all i∈Zi\in\mathbb{Z}i∈Z. The family ddd as well as its components dnd_{n}dn​ is called the differential of boundary morphism. Definition 2. A morphism of complexes f:(A,dA)→(B,dB)f:(A,d^{A})\to (B,d^{B})f:(A,dA)→(B,dB) is a family of morphisms: fn:An→Bnf_{n}:A_{n}\to B_{n}fn​:An​→Bn​, n∈Zn\in \mathbb{Z}n∈Z s.t. the diagram commutes. To simplify the notation, we always write it as fdA=dBffd^{A}=d^{B}ffdA=dBf. The category of chain complex in A\mathcal{A}A is denoted Ch(A)\mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})Ch(A). The full subcategory whose objects are of the form $$\cdots\xrightarrow{}A_{1}\xrightarrow{}A_{0}\xrightarrow{}0\xrightarrow{}\cdots$$ is denoted Ch≥0(A)\mathrm{Ch}_{\geq 0}(\mathcal{A})Ch≥0​(A). If A\mathcal{A}A is an addicitive category, it’s easy to verify Ch(A)\mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})Ch(A) is an abelian category. Proposition 1. For morphism f:A→Bf:A\to Bf:A→B, fff is injective(resp. surjective) if and only if fn:An→Bnf_{n}:A_{n}\to B_{n}fn​:An​→Bn​ is injective(resp. surjective) for all nnn. Proof Proof. Obvious. ◻ Proposition 2. A→fB→gCA\xrightarrow{f}B\xrightarrow{g}CAf​Bg​C is exact if and only if for all nnn, An→fnBn→gnCnA_{n}\xrightarrow{f_{n}}B_{n}\xrightarrow{g_{n}}C_{n}An​fn​​Bn​gn​​Cn​ are exact. Proof Proof. Obvious. ◻ Homology Definition 3. Let AAA be a chain complex, the nnn-th homology group of AAA is defined to be Hn(A)=Kerdn/Imdn+1H_{n}(A)=\mathrm{Ker}d_{n} /\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}Hn​(A)=Kerdn​/Imdn+1​. From the diagram we can derive H(fn):Hn(A)→Hn(B)H(f_{n}):H_{n}(A)\to H_{n}(B)H(fn​):Hn​(A)→Hn​(B) by fn:KerdnA→KerdnBf_{n}:\mathrm{Ker}d_{n}^{A}\to \mathrm{Ker}d_{n}^{B}fn​:KerdnA​→KerdnB​ and fn:Imdn+1A→Imdn+1Bf_{n}:\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{A}\to \mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{B}fn​:Imdn+1A​→Imdn+1B​ and the universal property of quotient. So we see actually H(−)H(-)H(−) is a functor Hn(−):Ch(A)→AH_{n}(-):\mathrm{Ch}(\mathcal{A})\to \mathcal{A}Hn​(−):Ch(A)→A. Often, in particular in applications to topology, elements of chain complex AnA_{n}An​ are called nnn-chains; elements of Kerdn\mathrm{Ker}d_{n}Kerdn​ are called nnn-cycles and Kerdn\mathrm{Ker}d_{n}Kerdn​ is written Zn=Zn(A)Z_n = Z_n(A)Zn​=Zn​(A); elements of Imdn+1\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}Imdn+1​ are called nnn-boundaries and Imdn+1\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}Imdn+1​ is written Bn=Bn(A)B_n = B_n(A)Bn​=Bn​(A). Two nnn-cycles which determine the same element in Hn(A)H_n(A)Hn​(A) are called homologous. The element of Hn(A)H_n(A)Hn​(A) determined by the nnn-cycle ccc is called the homology class of ccc, and is denoted by [c][c][c]. Cochain Complex Definition 4. A chain complex (A,d)(A,d)(A,d) in an addicitive category A\mathcal{A}A is a family of objects and morphisms: ⋯→An−1→dn−1An→dnAn+1→⋯\cdots\xrightarrow{}A^{n-1}\xrightarrow{d_{n-1}}A^{n}\xrightarrow{d^{n}}A^{n+1}\xrightarrow{}\cdots ⋯​An−1dn−1​​Andn​An+1​⋯ with di∘di+1=0d^{i}\circ d^{i+1}=0di∘di+1=0 for all i∈Zi\in\mathbb{Z}i∈Z. The morphisms and cohomology functor is defined similarly. For a chain complex A=(An,dnA)A=(A_{n},d_{n}^{A})A=(An​,dnA​), we can obtain a cochain complex B=(Bn,dBn)B=(B^{n},d^{n}_{B})B=(Bn,dBn​) by setting Bn=A−nB^{n}=A_{-n}Bn=A−n​ and dBn=d−nAd^{n}_{B}=d_{-n}^{A}dBn​=d−nA​. Long Exact Sequence Theorem Lemma 1 (Snake lemma). Let AAA be an abelian category. Let be a commutative diagram with exact rows. There exists a unique morphism δ:Kerγ→Cokerα\delta:\mathrm{Ker}\gamma\to \mathrm{Coker}\alphaδ:Kerγ→Cokerα s.t. the diagram commutes, where π′\pi'π′, π\piπ are the canonical projections and τ\tauτ, τ′\tau'τ′ are the canonical injections. The induced sequence $$\mathrm{Ker}\alpha\xrightarrow{f’}\mathrm{Ker}\alpha\xrightarrow{f’}\mathrm{Ker}\beta\xrightarrow{g’}\mathrm{Ker}\gamma\xrightarrow{\delta}\mathrm{Coker}\alpha\xrightarrow{k’}\mathrm{Coker}\beta\xrightarrow{l’}\mathrm{Coker}\gamma$$ is exact. If fff is injective the so is f′f'f′, and if lll is surjective then so is l′l'l′. Proof Proof. See Stack Project 010Hhttps://stacks.math.columbia.edu/tag/010H. ◻ Theorem 1 (Long exact seq.). Given a short exact seq. of chain complexes 0→A→fB→gC→00\xrightarrow{}A\xrightarrow{f}B\xrightarrow{g}C\xrightarrow{}00​Af​Bg​C​0, there are connecting morphisms δn:Hn(C)→Hn−1(A)\delta_{n}:H_{n}(C)\to H_{n-1}(A)δn​:Hn​(C)→Hn−1​(A) s.t. $$\cdots\xrightarrow{} H_{n}(A)\xrightarrow{}H_{n}(B)\xrightarrow{}H_{n}( C)\xrightarrow{\delta_{n}}H_{n-1}(A)\xrightarrow{}H_{n-1}(B)\xrightarrow{}H_{n-1}( C)\xrightarrow{}\cdots$$ is an exact sequence. Proof Proof. Consider exact sequence:0→An→fnBn→gnCn→00\xrightarrow{}A_{n}\xrightarrow{f_{n}}B_{n}\xrightarrow{g_{n}}C_{n}\xrightarrow{}0 0​An​fn​​Bn​gn​​Cn​​0Since fnf_{n}fn​ takes Imdn+1A\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{A}Imdn+1A​ to Imdn+1B\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{B}Imdn+1B​, gng_{n}gn​ takes Imdn+1B\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{B}Imdn+1B​ to Imdn+1C\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{ C}Imdn+1C​, we have the sequence $$A_{n} /\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{A}\xrightarrow{\bar{f_{n}}} B_{n} /\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{B}\xrightarrow{\bar{g_{n}}}C_{n} /\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{ C}$$ exact. Since gng_{n}gn​ surjective, gnˉ\bar{g_{n}}gn​ˉ​ is also surjective. We have the exact sequence $$A_{n} /\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{A}\xrightarrow{\bar{f_{n}}} B_{n} /\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{B}\xrightarrow{\bar{g_{n}}}C_{n} /\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{ C}\xrightarrow{}0$$Similarly,0→KerdnA→KerdnB→KerdnC0\xrightarrow{}\mathrm{Ker}d_{n}^{A}\xrightarrow{}\mathrm{Ker}d_{n}^{B}\xrightarrow{}\mathrm{Ker}d_{n}^{C}0​KerdnA​​KerdnB​​KerdnC​is an exact sequence.Since dn∘dn+1=0d_{n}\circ d_{n+1}=0dn​∘dn+1​=0, we have dn+1Ad_{n+1}^{A}dn+1A​ restric to An/Imdn+1AA_{n} /\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{A}An​/Imdn+1A​ to KerdnA\mathrm{Ker}d_{n}^{A}KerdnA​, we ge the commutative diagram:Ker(dnA:An/Imdn+1A→KerdnA)=Hn(A)\mathrm{Ker}(d_{n}^{A}:A_{n} /\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{A}\to \mathrm{Ker}d_{n}^{A})=H_{n}(A)Ker(dnA​:An​/Imdn+1A​→KerdnA​)=Hn​(A) and Coker(dnA:An/Imdn+1A→KerdnA)=Hn−1(A)\mathrm{Coker}(d_{n}^{A}:A_{n} /\mathrm{Im}d_{n+1}^{A}\to \mathrm{Ker}d_{n}^{A})=H_{n-1}(A)Coker(dnA​:An​/Imdn+1A​→KerdnA​)=Hn−1​(A), by snake lemma, it induces $$\cdots\xrightarrow{} H_{n}(A)\xrightarrow{}H_{n}(B)\xrightarrow{}H_{n}( C)\xrightarrow{\delta_{n}}H_{n-1}(A)\xrightarrow{}H_{n-1}(B)\xrightarrow{}H_{n-1}( C)\xrightarrow{}\cdots$$ ◻ Similarly result for cochain. For any [c]∈Hn(C)[c]\in H_{n}(C)[c]∈Hn​(C), ∃b∈Bn\exists b\in B_{n}∃b∈Bn​ s.t. gn(b)=cg_{n}(b)=cgn​(b)=c. Then gn−1(dnB(b))=dnC(gn(b))g_{n-1}(d_{n}^{B}(b))=d_{n}^{C}(g_{n}(b))gn−1​(dnB​(b))=dnC​(gn​(b)). ∃a∈An−1\exists a\in A_{n-1}∃a∈An−1​ with fn−1(a)=dnB(b)f_{n-1}(a)=d_{n}^{B}(b)fn−1​(a)=dnB​(b). The map δ\deltaδ takes [c][c][c] to [a][a][a].

posts.title: An example of direct sum but not split exact sequence
posts.excerpt: 一个含有direct sum的short exact sequence但不是split short exact sequence的例子.
posts.text: 一个含有direct sum的short exact sequence但不是split short exact sequence的例子. Recall the definition of split exact sequence We say a short exact sequence split iff. it is isomorphic to the exact sequence 0→A→fA⊕B→gB→00\xrightarrow{} A\xrightarrow{f} A\oplus B \xrightarrow{g} B\xrightarrow{}0 0​Af​A⊕Bg​B​0 where fff is the inclusion of the first component and ggg is the projection onto the second component. 注意到split exact seq 在定义里要求fff 和ggg 分别是到A⊕BA\oplus BA⊕B的每一个component, 是否有例子使得一般的short exact seq s.t. 0→A→fA⊕B→gB→00\xrightarrow{} A\xrightarrow{f} A\oplus B \xrightarrow{g} B\xrightarrow{}00​Af​A⊕Bg​B​0 但是不是exact seq? 答案是Yes. Example of non split exact sequence Consider the short exact sequence 0→Z/2Z→fZ/4Z→gZ/2Z→00\xrightarrow{} \mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\xrightarrow{f} \mathbb{Z}/4\mathbb{Z} \xrightarrow{g} \mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\xrightarrow{}0 0​Z/2Zf​Z/4Zg​Z/2Z​0 where fff is the inclusion of the subgroup generated by 2, so f(1)=2f(1) = 2f(1)=2, and ggg is the quotient onto that subgroup, meaning g(1)=1g(1) = 1g(1)=1. This is not a split short exact sequence(obviously). Consider M⨁N(Z/2Z⊕Z/4Z)M\bigoplus\limits_{\mathbb{N}}(\mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\oplus\mathbb{Z}/4\mathbb{Z})MN⨁​(Z/2Z⊕Z/4Z). Thus the exact seq 0→Z/2Z→hZ/4Z⊕M→iZ/2Z⊕M→00\xrightarrow{} \mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\xrightarrow{h} \mathbb{Z}/4\mathbb{Z}\oplus M \xrightarrow{i} \mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\oplus M\xrightarrow{}0 0​Z/2Zh​Z/4Z⊕Mi​Z/2Z⊕M​0 with h(a)=(f(a),0)h(a) = (f(a), 0)h(a)=(f(a),0) and t(a,m)=(g(a),m)t(a, m) = (g(a), m)t(a,m)=(g(a),m) is exact. Z/4Z⊕M\mathbb{Z}/4\mathbb{Z}\oplus MZ/4Z⊕M is isomorphic to (Z/2Z)⊕(Z/2Z⊕M)(\mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z})\oplus(\mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\oplus M)(Z/2Z)⊕(Z/2Z⊕M). However, this is not a split exact seq since 0→Z/2Z→hZ/4Z⊕M→iZ/2Z⊕M→00\xrightarrow{} \mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\xrightarrow{h} \mathbb{Z}/4\mathbb{Z}\oplus M \xrightarrow{i} \mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\oplus M\xrightarrow{}0 0​Z/2Zh​Z/4Z⊕Mi​Z/2Z⊕M​0 will give a exact seq $$0\xrightarrow{} \mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\xrightarrow{f} \mathbb{Z}/4\mathbb{Z} \xrightarrow{g} \mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}\xrightarrow{}0$$ which is not split exact.
